title: Inflation derivative
text:
In <a href="finance">finance</a>, inflation derivative (or inflation-indexed derivatives) refers to an <a href="over-the-counter%20%28finance%29">over-the-counter</a> and exchange-traded <a href="derivative%20%28finance%29">derivative</a> that is used to transfer <a href="inflation">inflation</a> risk from one counterparty to another. See <a href="Exotic%20derivatives">Exotic derivatives</a>.
Derivative.
Typically, <a href="interest%20rate%20swap">real rate swaps</a> also come under this bracket, such as <a href="asset%20swap">asset swap</a>s of <a href="inflation-indexed%20bond">inflation-indexed bond</a>s (government-issued inflation-indexed bonds, such as the <a href="Treasury%20Inflation%20Protected%20Securities">Treasury Inflation Protected Securities</a>, UK inflation-linked <a href="gilt-edged%20securities">gilt-edged securities</a> (ILGs), French OATeis, Italian BTPeis, German Bundeis and Japanese <a href="JGBi">JGBi</a>s are prominent examples). <a href="Inflation%20swap">Inflation swap</a>s are the linear form of these derivatives. They can take a similar form to fixed versus floating <a href="interest%20rate%20swaps">interest rate swaps</a> (which are the derivative form for fixed rate bonds), but use a <a href="real%20rate%20coupon">real rate coupon</a> versus <a href="Public%20float">floating</a>, but also pay a <a href="redemption%20pickup">redemption pickup</a> at <a href="maturity%20%28finance%29">maturity</a> (i.e., the derivative form of <a href="inflation-indexed%20bond">inflation-indexed bond</a>s).
<a href="Inflation%20swap">Inflation swap</a>s are typically priced on a <a href="Zero-coupon%20bond">zero-coupon</a> basis (ZC) (like <a href="ZCIIS">ZCIIS</a> for example), with payment exchanged at the end of the term. One party pays the <a href="compounded%20fixed">compounded fixed</a> rate and the other the actual <a href="inflation">inflation</a> rate for the term. Inflation swaps can also be paid on a <a href="wikt%3Ayear-on-year">year-on-year</a> basis (YOY) (like <a href="YYIIS">YYIIS</a> for example) where the year-on-year rate of change of the price index is paid, typically yearly as in the case of most European YOY swaps, but also monthly for many swapped notes in the US market. Even though the <a href="coupons">coupons</a> are paid monthly, the <a href="inflation%20rate">inflation rate</a> used is still the year-on-year rate.
<a href="Option%20%28finance%29">Options</a> on inflation including <a href="Interest%20rate%20cap%20and%20floor">interest rate caps</a>, <a href="Interest%20rate%20cap%20and%20floor">interest rate floors</a> and <a href="straddle">straddle</a>s can also be <a href="traded">traded</a>. These are typically priced against YOY swaps, whilst the <a href="swaption">swaption</a> is priced on the <a href="ZC%20curve">ZC curve</a>.
<a href="Asset%20swaps">Asset swaps</a> also exist where the <a href="coupon%20payment">coupon payment</a> of the linker (inflation bond) as well as the <a href="redemption%20pickup">redemption pickup</a> at <a href="maturity%20%28finance%29">maturity</a> is exchanged for <a href="interest%20rate">interest rate</a> payments expressed as a <a href="Risk%20premium">premium</a> or <a href="discounting">discount</a> to <a href="LIBOR">LIBOR</a> for the relevant <a href="bond%20coupon">bond coupon</a> period, all dates are <a href="co-terminus">co-terminus</a>. The <a href="redemption%20pickup">redemption pickup</a> is the above <a href="Par%20value">par</a> redemption value in the case of par/par <a href="asset%20swaps">asset swaps</a>, or the redemption above the proceeds <a href="notional">notional</a> in the case of the proceeds <a href="asset%20swap">asset swap</a>. The proceeds <a href="notional">notional</a> equals the <a href="dirty%20nominal%20price">dirty nominal price</a> of the bond at the time of purchase and is used as the <a href="fixed%20notional">fixed notional</a> on the <a href="LIBOR">LIBOR</a> leg.
<a href="Real%20rate%20swaps">Real rate swaps</a> are the <a href="nominal%20interest%20swap%20rate">nominal interest swap rate</a> less the corresponding inflation swap.
